title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: It was on a very fresh, sweet May morning, that Marjory and Iwere married in the old Kirk of Lyne, which stands high on a knoll abovethe Lyne Water, with green hills huddled around the door.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: I sawthe thin smoke curling up from the little village of Lyne, and Lyne Kirkstanding on its whin-covered brae, and the bonny holms of Lyne Water,where I had often taken great baskets of trout.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: At the Lyne Water ford, Michael Veitch was waiting for me.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: I crossed Lyne Water by the new bridge, just finished in the yearbefore, and entered the wood of Dawyck.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: Before me the Lyne Water hills were green as grass with no patch ofheather, and to the left, the mighty form of Scrape, half-clothed inforest, lay quiet and sunlit.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: "I maun be awa'," he said, speaking tohimself, "and a sair job I'll hae gettin' ower Lyne Water."

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: Theparks around stretched to Manor village on the one side, and nigh to thefoot of the Lyne Water on the other.
